text: [Music]
hello I'm too mellow a cloud Support
Engineer here at the a SS office in Cape
Town sometimes customers ask me how they
can help prevent storage for issues by
monitoring Amazon RDS free store space I
tell them you can use The Awl
I to create Amazon CloudWatch alarms
that monitor free storage space by
creating Claridge alarms that notify you
when the free storage space metric which
is a defined threshold you can prevent
storage for issues doing that helps
prevent downtime that occurs when your
RDS DB instance runs out of storage
let me walk you through this process
first you'll have to sign in to the AWS
CLI using an IM role with permissions to
create an Amazon SNS topic and a cloud
watch alarm
after you sign into the Adria CLI you'll
create an Amazon SNS topic that can send
emails you do this with the following
command make sure you note the SNS on of
the topic as you will be using it in the
next steps let's move on now you
subscribe an email address to the topic
then confirm the subscription a
confirmation message is sent by email to
the address that you specified you have
successfully created and subscribed to
the SNS topic next create a cloud wash
alarm to alert you when free storage
space for a TB instance is below 25 gb
you do this with this command please
note you must specify the value for the
free storage space parameter in bytes
now let's create a second critical cloud
raj alarm to notify you when free
storage space for devious instance is
below 10 gb important after an alarm is
created the alarm state is insufficient
data until the metrics populate to the
alarm now finally you can use the
describe alarm command to check the
details in the status of the alarms
created
you will now see a summary of the to
creator cloud watch alums thanks for
watching and happy cloud computing from
all of us here headed over the years
